comments:
While writing RCP examples I keep getting a confusing error at run-time. I'm 
running the application using a run-time workbench, and under the Plug-ins and 
Fragments tab of the launch configuration I select Choose plug-ins and 
fragments to launch from the list. Then I list all the plug-ins that the 
application needs. This is a royal pain to keep up because when I miss one I 
get a cryptic error in the .log file that the application could not be located 
(shown below). 

First of all, the list of required plug-ins should be maintained for me, but 
even if it's not, then the error message should tell the user which plug-in is 
missing. It would be nice if the error were printed in the console by default, 
too, so the budding RCP application developer doesn't have to know about .log 
to start with.

!SESSION Jan 04, 2004 16:30:51.558 --------------------------------------------
-
java.version=1.4.1
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments: -pdelaunch -dev bin -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -nl 
en_US
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 13 Jan 04, 2004 16:30:51.558
!MESSAGE Unable to locate application extension: 
org.eclipsepowered.rcptutorial3.RcpApplication
!STACK 0
java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to locate application extension: 
org.eclipsepowered.rcptutorial3.RcpApplication
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run
(PlatformActivator.java:205)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run
(EclipseStarter.java:85)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:279)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:742)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:581)

It looks like this kind of error reporting was lost when we moved to the Equinox
runtime. It used to create log entries like:

plugin "x" could not be loaded because it is missing required plug-in "y".

These error messages no longer seem to appear. I agree that the resulting log
entry is very cryptic.

Ed, with regard to your comment about having to maintain the pre-reqs manually,
I suggest you enter an enhancement request against PDE UI.  It feels like they
should be able to provide a fourth option in the "plugins and fragments" tab of
the launch configuration along the lines of "Launch with all plug-ins required
by this application".  

I have been doing some RCP application writing as well, and I feel your pain
about manually configuring this list. The approach I've been using is to ensure
that every plug-in I need is in the workspace (as binary plug-ins for the ones
I'm not working on).  I then remove all external plugins from my target platform
(prefs > plugin development > target platform > Deselect all). Then I can 
always use "Launch with all workspace and enabled external plug-ins" in the
launch configuration. Most non-RCP developers just launch with all internal and
external plug-ins enabled, but in the RCP case you want to test against a
limited configuration.

Agree wholeheartedly about the error logging.  The current behaviour is 
characteristic of us implementing a new resolver (rather than the move to OSGi 
per se).   We had a bug related to this but cannot find it now.  The basic idea 
is that we are/will be able to produce a state summary that includes details 
about any resolution issues.  There is alot more potential here than in the 
previous story we have just not tapped it.  

Re maintaining the list of prereqs, this is a PDE issue as John mentioned.
Ok, two PDE UI issues have been entered: see bug 49591 and bug 49592.

Yup, this is one of the nastiest problem to debug. Just spent almost a day for this thing until I get to this bug. Hopefully, the new feature scheduled for M7 would help a little bit. I haven't got a chance to try it out though.

Fixed as a consequence of bug 50168 being fixed.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 50168 ***
